title: AUS vs IND 2024: Full list of commentators and presenters for Border-Gavaskar Trophy
description: The first Test of the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy starts later this week at The Optus (November 22) at the Optus Stadium in Perth. Here's the full list of who's commentating on the series.
author: Katya Witney
excerpt: The first Test of the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy starts later this week at The Optus (November 22) at the Optus Stadium in Perth. Here's the full list of who's commentating on the series.
text: The first Test of the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy starts later this week at The Optus (November 22) at the Optus Stadium in Perth. Here's the full list of who's commentating on the series. There will a start-studded lineup to cover the series on TV and live-stream, with Seven network and Fox providing the coverage in Australia. After the first Test in Perth,, the series will move on to Adelaide at the beginning of December, before stopping in Brisbane and Melbourne before finishing up in Sydney in the New Year. Seven's coverage will include former Australia internationals Trent Copeland, Aaron Finch, Damien Fleming, Matthew Hayden, Simon Katich, Justin Langer and Ricky Ponting. They will also have India legend Sunil Gavaskar and former ICC umpire Simon Taufel as part of their coverage. Also read: Fox also have plenty of recognisable names on their coverage. Allan Border, Adam Gilchrist, Mike Hussey, Brett Lee, Mark Waugh and David Warner are all on their books, as well as Michael Vaughan, Harsha Bhogle, Ravi Shastri and Isa Guha. There's plenty to discuss ahead of the series, with both Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill out of contention for the first Test, leaving India with a selection headache ahead of the game. Australia are also set to field a new opener for the Perth Test, with Nathan McSweeney replacing Steve Smith at the top of the order, the latter sliding back down to the No.4 slot. Full list: Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/2025 commentators Seven & Sevenplus Greg Blewett James Brayshaw Trent Copeland Aaron Finch (first two Tests only) Damien Fleming Sunil Gavaskar Matthew Hayden (first three Tests only) Simon Katich Rachel Khawaja Tim Lane Justin Langer Mel McLaughlin Alison Mitchell Alister Nicholson Ricky Ponting Simon Taufel Foxtel & Kayo Harsha Bhogle Allan Border Adam Gilchrist Isa Guha Mark Howard Mike Hussey Brendon Julian Brett Lee Kath Loughnan Kerry O'Keefe Ravi Shastri Michael Vaughan David Warner Mark Waugh Follow Wisden for all cricket updates, including live scores, match stats, quizzes and more. Stay up to date with the latest cricket news, player updates, team standings, match highlights, video analysis and live match odds.
html:
The first Test of the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy starts later this week at The Optus (November 22) at the Optus Stadium in Perth. Here's the full list of who's commentating on the series.

There will a start-studded lineup to cover the series on TV and live-stream, with Seven network and Fox providing the coverage in Australia. After the first Test in Perth,, the series will move on to Adelaide at the beginning of December, before stopping in Brisbane and Melbourne before finishing up in Sydney in the New Year.

Seven's coverage will include former Australia internationals Trent Copeland, Aaron Finch, Damien Fleming, Matthew Hayden, Simon Katich, Justin Langer and Ricky Ponting. They will also have India legend Sunil Gavaskar and former ICC umpire Simon Taufel as part of their coverage.

Also read:

Fox also have plenty of recognisable names on their coverage. Allan Border, Adam Gilchrist, Mike Hussey, Brett Lee, Mark Waugh and David Warner are all on their books, as well as Michael Vaughan, Harsha Bhogle, Ravi Shastri and Isa Guha.

There's plenty to discuss ahead of the series, with both Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill out of contention for the first Test, leaving India with a selection headache ahead of the game. Australia are also set to field a new opener for the Perth Test, with Nathan McSweeney replacing Steve Smith at the top of the order, the latter sliding back down to the No.4 slot.

Full list: Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/2025 commentators

Seven & Sevenplus

  • Greg Blewett
  • James Brayshaw
  • Trent Copeland
  • Aaron Finch (first two Tests only)
  • Damien Fleming
  • Sunil Gavaskar
  • Matthew Hayden (first three Tests only)
  • Simon Katich
  • Rachel Khawaja
  • Tim Lane
  • Justin Langer
  • Mel McLaughlin
  • Alison Mitchell
  • Alister Nicholson
  • Ricky Ponting
  • Simon Taufel

Foxtel & Kayo

  • Harsha Bhogle
  • Allan Border
  • Adam Gilchrist
  • Isa Guha
  • Mark Howard
  • Mike Hussey
  • Brendon Julian
  • Brett Lee
  • Kath Loughnan
  • Kerry O'Keefe
  • Ravi Shastri
  • Michael Vaughan
  • David Warner
  • Mark Waugh
